verses.roman:
śivānandera patnī tāṅre kahena kāndiyā
'putre śāpa dichena gosāñi vāsā nā pāñā'

synonyms: śivānandera—of Śivānanda Sena; patnī—the wife; tāṅre—unto him; kahena—says; kāndiyā—crying; putre—on our sons; śāpa—curse; dichena—awarded; gosāñi—Nityānanda Prabhu; vāsā nā pāñā—not getting His residential quarters.
translation: Crying, his wife informed him, "Lord Nityānanda has cursed our sons to die because His quarters have not been provided."
